reviewText:
Early Access Review

Like town of salem? Wish it wasnt so turn based? What about trouble in terrorist town, but wish it wasnt first person?
Well you got that my friend, with the lovely game....
Trouble in the manor.

Ive been waiting for this game for so long, and i gotta say: so far, i think this game pretty cool!
It just came out, so it doesnt have very many players, which is why im writing this review!
It takes the awesome who did the murder" from town of salem and TTT
date: and completely takes out the waiting process.\nRun around in a distant manor searching for the murderer
recommended: or trying to BE the murderer.\nteam up

reviewText:
This game seems to be pretty well made and I like the art style. However, it's a complete ghost town- as of writing this there's one server up with nobody on it (and then that server ejects me after five seconds of waiting, which I don't entirely understand.)

If you're willing to buy copies for all your friends (or your friends actually have money), absolutely buy this game. Otherwise... yeah.

On a slightly related note, I think this is a game that's been crippled by Early Access- the launch hype was too spread out and it wasn't able to solidify a good player base. If the dev(s) had instead kept Beta exclusive to youtubers with the intention of building hype, I think there would've been a sufficient playerbase at launch to keep this going. (Absolutely not a professional so take my opinion with a grain of salt.)

reviewText:
This is a multiplayer only game with a small community, make sure you have friends to play with since most multiplayer matches will otherwise turn into a bloodbath or remain empty. You need to learn how to port forward if you want to run your own server or incase the public server is down.

It has a few game crashing bugs, it could use tooltips, and the controls are a little messy, but the developer is active and improving the game constantly.

I would say for the 49 cent sale it's currently on, if you have friends buy it! Having more players makes it much better!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

There's a lot to do and there is good humor. (There's a playable piano)

The game is very unique, with mechanics you won't find in most other games, let alone mystery games. And the combat system is choppy but satisfying; along with killing people in general.

But the game is early access, and because of this there is lag, a few bugs, and the movement is choppy; but as of the time I am writing this review the game has just been released, meaning these bugs will most likely be fixed.

And the developers are very dedicated and involved within the community, even before the time of release the devs were answering people's questions.

Overall 8/10.
voteText: 11 of 14 people (79%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Trouble in The Manor has an interesting concept, great graphics, and is pretty fun to play. .

However, as others have mentioned, there are a few cons with this game. First, and most importantly, the lack of players. The servers usually have very little players on them, and it can be difficult to find a game with over 5 players online. Due to this, I find the game is best played with a group friends.

The combat is also a bit choppy and could use improvement, but overall isn't that bad.

It's a fun little mystery game to play with some friends, and despite the few issues it has, I recommend picking it up - plus it's only $4.99 (or less if on sale!).

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have seen a number of games take a stab at the 'Trouble In Terrorist Town' game idea. Quite a few that may never come to be. Trouble In The Manor is a great game and does what it's meant to do.

Even for an early access release this game has already reached close to it's full potential in terms of gameplay. Perhaps more maps and a few more weapons down the road could be added but the gameplay is already there. I have yet to experience any bugs at the time of writing this review.

There is a whole lot of games taking a stab at copying 'Trouble In Terrorist Town' (as I already said), but this one does it best by far. And the developer is dedicated to the game and very friendly. I highly recommend this game.

* Update (11/11/15) *
It has been a number of months (3 months and some time) since the last time this game was updated. While I still enjoy the game it has unfortunately lost the interest of its current fan base and due to that there are no servers up. I hope to see this game come back to life in the future but as of now it is not looking too brighty and shiny. :P

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Trouble in the Manor: A game where you are simply running around aimlessly, hoarding all that sweet dosh that you've found on the ground or other hallway objects, buying weapons, collecting some sort of evidence, and soon you'll be on your way to start shooting all of your possibly suspicious fellow players. As a murderer, you have to blend in with the crowd, play innocent and kill as many of your friends and unsuspecting victims before time runs out or before your murderous crew ends up as a bloody mess.

Albeit, it's still in development and some bugs still need to be killed, it's a pretty fun game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Before reading this review, please note that this is an early access game, and will subject to change as it further develops.

I've been waiting for this game for quite some time when I first saw the game on Greenlight back in December of 2014. It's an extremely good, and addicting game. I've met some really cool people who really make the game fun to play. The only issues I have with the game currently, is lack of players (just came out), and a few bugs (nothing too major.)

The game takes a lot of influence from Garry's Mod Trouble in Terrorist town, where you have 3 classes; Detective, Innocent, and the Traitors. This game has 4; Bloodhound (essentially like the Detective), Innocent, Murder (like the Traitors), and Vampires. The object is the same; track down, and deduce who the murders are. However, as a murder you can become a vampire, and infect others so that they too can become Vampires, creating your whole army of Vampires.

As an innocent, you really need to stick with the bloodhounds (detectives) to try and track down the murders.  The bloodhounds can use a DNA scanner to try and match who the killer is with the victim's corpse, or can even use a seance to talk with the dead to gain information about who the culprit is. The murder is by far the most fun to play as. Lie and decieve is your game, and with many tools/weapons in your arsenal, it's an absolute blast to lie and stab your way to victory.

You'll need to collect coins spread out throughout the manor, and in some objects, to be able to purchase weapons, teleporters, and other tools at your disposal. Keep in mind, each class has a different loadout out, e.x. a murder can purchase a flamethrower, but a innocent can't.

For the price of $5.49 in it's current state, I highly recommend this game. I've put in almost 7 hours, and I'm still having an absolute blast playing this game, and learning more about the game.

With a great, and active community, I can only see this game getting better.
voteText: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Collect coins to prepare yourself for trouble in the manor! This game is really fun, but don't think it's going to be easy. Murderers have to plan out their kills, making sure to blend in with the innocent, but at the same time choose their next victim! There are so many little tricks, like teaming up with a vampire teamate and making innocent players run into a spike trap is satisfying! So many ways to kill, so little time! Remote bombs, Vampires, Spike traps are really fun to try out; did I mention that you can also poison rooms and turn off the lights?

Never the same gameplay, I'm always finding new ways to avoid getting caught, or avoiding vampires! Definitely fun with friends, I would recommend.

Try to stay out of sight innocents, because I'm coming for you!

10/10 would kill everyone again.

reviewText: This is such as good litlle indie/horror game. A game of murderous intentions, strategy and trust.  It is really authentic and it's really fun to play. Based around a murder mystery storyline, players have to figure out who is the murderer through their powers of deduction. The Murderer, whoever that may be, must kill all the other players before the time runs out. The innocents and the detectives must figure out which player is the murderer and kill him/her before the time runs out. Full of add-ons and little quips with to mess around, this is a little gem in my library, and one that will continue to shine for the rest of its days. Rated 8/10

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nHonestly I love this game. Being able to work together to find the murderers or to kill all the innocents, it's something you actually have to put thought into. A game where you can't just run around and kill people, but have to think of a strategic plan in order not to get caught. No two rounds are the same, and every round brings new opportunity to try out something new, whether that being setting up traps a certain way, staying in a group or even laying low, there is many ways to go about it, and that is one of the reasons why I love this game.

reviewText:
I was contacted by the dev on my last review, so i figured id try to be fair, since he seemed a bit upset that I had given a bad one for there being no one on the game.

His words

==Studge  [developer] 24 minutes ago
Few things:

- Working as the sole marketer it is nearly impossible for me to market it further than I already have been as I do have other work to do and without the Kickstarter funding we desperately needed, it is extremely hard to market the game further

- You are free, completely free, to invite your friends to play the game if you feel there aren't enough people.

- We do get people on the main server every day. This game is not completely dead.


And you are correct on the settings, we are trying to update the game but unfortunately the game engine software we used is having an issue getting the Steam SDK to launch properly so we have to wait for them to update that. Until then we can't update the game.==

So Heres the full scope of it, The game doesnt have a huge playerbase because he cannot market it, and apparently he is working alone on this project. He also seems to plan on continuing to work on it despite taking it out of early access (I hope that holds up, i doubt he would have responded personally if he didnt plan to)

So Based on gameplay, yes, its a good game, but buy it for some friends or get them to buy it, because in the few times i checked the servers were dead.

Small indie devs like this can make the best game in the universe but wont get anywhere without some marketing, and without funding to pay for some kind of AD, he really only has word of mouth or youtubers. So my challenge to the one or two people who will see this, is try not to let this game die. Its not a bad game, its like a mix of garrys mod's murder game with the art of the escapists, its a great concept and an inexpensive game with a good art style, its worth trying or playing with friends. Its easy to complain about the game having no one on it, but players are the only ones who can change that!
